description: Intelligent aquaculture IoT system “Aquadlink” to increase quality and yield rate
Scenario: It is freezing cold, and nobody could withstand the weather. The sky is gloomy and this cold front is expected to last a couple more days. Local fish farmers in Taiwan reluctantly find their milkfish dying one after another due to this drastic weather, causing a great loss to their livelihood.
pain_points_and_needs: •	Lack of aquaculture alarming system to cope with natural disasters
•	Current measures not effective to find reasons behind changes in the fish farms
•	As of now, fish farmers manage their assets by pure sight. It is difficult to get the whole picture of their aquaculture environment
•	Difficult to identify factors that decrease fish farming productivity
smart_solution: “Aquadlink” is an intelligent aquaculture IoT service system with LoRa transmission and intelligent equipment control. Through computers, smartphones, and pads, farmers can remotely control the cultivation environment and monitor variables such as oxygen level, pH value, as well as salinity and water temperature. The IoT system not only collects water data, but also sends out early warnings through data analysis to help increase quality and yield rate.
adopted_technology: IoT sensors and controllers, data analytics via cloud and LoRa
benefits: •	Help at least 250 domestic aquaculture fields in Taiwan to monitor the critical value of the environment in real time.
•	Reduce loss caused by environmental factors with proper precautions and warnings
•	Improve the efficiency of human operations
•	Cooperate with companies in the supply chain to export cultivating solution to Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines.
solution_description: Quadlink Technology “Aquadlink,” an intelligent aquaculture service system. Through LoRa transmission and intelligent equipment control, farmers could use PC, smartphones, pads to remotely monitor and control their aquaculture fields, and to increase quality and yield rate.
reference_site: Aquaculture fields in Pingtung, Kaohsiung, Tainan, Chiayi, Hualien, etc. Aquaculture fields in foreign countries including Indonesia, Malaysia, and the Philippines.
